bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Oxford University Press, September 11, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests a copy of Carlos E. Finlay's book about his father, Carlos J. Finlay.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Oxford University Press, September 11, 1940

opener.dateline:
September 11, 1940 The Oxford University Press
114 Fifth Avenue
New York City

div1.p:
Please send me at your earliest possible convenience,
a copy of Dr. Carlos E. Finlay's book regarding the work of his father on
yellow fever. I will remit promptly.

The reason I am anxious to have this at your earliest
possible convenience is that I have been asked to present an address on
the conquest of yellow fever, to be read October 26, on the occasion of
the dedication of the Lazear Memorial Building at Washington and Jefferson
College. In connection with the preparation of this address, I have
visited some of the survivors of the yellow fever work in Cuba and visited
Dr. Finlay while there. He promised to let me have a manuscript in prepara-
tion for my address, but now writes me that the book is finished and ready
for distribution. Naturally, therefore, I should prefer to have the book.
It is on his advice that I am writing you so that if the publication of this
book is some time in the future, I hope that in this instance, at least, you
will permit me to purchase a copy at once, as I am most anxious (as is Dr.
Finlay also) to present a true picture of Dr. Finlay's work.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
